wiki_description:
"Clifton still recites his prayers, but they are grown strange as old mirrors. He rises every morning to greet the dawn. He looks it full in the face, and tells you exactly what he sees."
'Pope' Clifton is a Lantern Follower. He is boisterous, unorthodox, and grandiose. If he rebels, he demands to be called 'your Holiness'.
A romantic relationship with 'Pope' Clifton may be started if he is spoken with Streets Strange by Moonlight. Temptation: Enlightenment or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Enlightenment) are also required to do so.

topic.description:
"Clifton still recites his prayers, but they are grown strange as old mirrors. He rises every morning to greet the dawn. He looks it full in the face, and tells you exactly what he sees."
'Pope' Clifton is a Lantern Follower. He is boisterous, unorthodox, and grandiose. If he rebels, he demands to be called 'your Holiness'.
A romantic relationship with 'Pope' Clifton may be started if he is spoken with Streets Strange by Moonlight. Temptation: Enlightenment or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Enlightenment) are also required to do so.

related_topics.description:
"Clifton still recites his prayers, but they are grown strange as old mirrors. He rises every morning to greet the dawn. He looks it full in the face, and tells you exactly what he sees."
'Pope' Clifton is a Lantern Follower. He is boisterous, unorthodox, and grandiose. If he rebels, he demands to be called 'your Holiness'.
A romantic relationship with 'Pope' Clifton may be started if he is spoken with Streets Strange by Moonlight. Temptation: Enlightenment or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Enlightenment) are also required to do so.

"Elridge is never seen with a spot of blood upon his person. Not a spot."
Elridge is an Edge Follower. He is controlling, orderly, sociopathic, and yet somewhat elegant. As he becomes stronger, his attention to detail becomes far sharper.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Elridge if he is spoken to and Oriflamme's Auction House is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Power or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Power) is also required to do so.

"Victor is a sly fellow, and he knows an unusual opportunity when he sees it."
Victor is a Edge Follower. He is elegant, gentlemanly, and cunning, and is very similar to his sister and lover Rose. If romanced, and even during his Ever After ending, he continues his relationship with his sister.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Victor if he is spoken to and The Ecdysis Club is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Sensation or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Sensation) is also required to do so.

"Rose is a sly miss, and she recognises you as someone uncommon."
Rose is a Edge Follower. She is elegant, passionate, polite, and cunning, and is very similar to her brother and lover Victor. If romanced, and even during her Ever After ending, she continues her relationship with her brother.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Rose if she is spoken to and The Ecdysis Club is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Sensation or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Sensation) is also required to do so.

"Valciane is not a machine. We are reasonably confident of that, because she has been observed, now and then, to commit quite human errors."
Valciane is a Forge Follower. She is curt, mechanical, emotionless, and inhumanly strong.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Valciane if she is spoken to and Oriflamme's Auction House is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Power or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Power) is also required to do so.

"Tristan dislikes distractions; Tristan likes results."
Tristan is a Forge Follower. He is practical, orderly, and calm. If he is romanced, his controlled demeanor begins to crack a little.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Tristan if he is spoken to and Oriflamme's Auction House is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Power or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Power) is also required to do so.

"Laidlaw has begun to understand the limitations of ingenuity, and the power of sacrifice."
Laidlaw is a Forge Follower. He is ingenious, indefatigable, creative, and unpredictable.
One may engage in a romantic relationship with Laidlaw if he is spoken to and Oriflamme's Auction House is chosen as the subject of discussion. Temptation: Power or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Power) is also required to do so.

"Cat lifts her teacup, drains it to the dregs, tilts the cup to study it critically. 'Why not,' she says. 'Why not indeed."
Cat Caro is a Lantern Follower. She is calm and watchful. A Medium and fortune-teller, her power lies in dreams.
A romantic relationship with Cat Caro requires speaking to her with Streets Strange by Moonlight. Temptation: Enlightenment or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Enlightenment) are also required to do so.

"Slee speaks exclusively in mathematics and in poetry. Both are compelling: it is increasingly difficult to tell the difference."
Slee is a Lantern Follower. He is scholarly and loves poetry, and is crippled by chronic headaches.
A romantic relationship with Slee may be started by speaking to him about Streets Strange by Moonlight. Temptation: Enlightenment or any of its forms (ex., Desire: Enlightenment) are also required to do so.

"A painting of a dark-skinned woman with snow-coloured eyes and close-cropped ivory-coloured hair. She stands before a small marble tomb overgrown with star jasmine. The painting is signed 'Jonas B. Munch, 1811'."
"Miss Naenia never speaks to me - she is only a painting - but afterwards, I always remember what she has said."
Miss Naenia is a Patron and a Name of The Elegiast. She takes the form of a painting which a character with the Medium? Legacy can speak with.

Grail is one of the Principles of the invisible arts, named after the Red Grail herself. It presides of all forms of hunger, thirst, and sensation, and is also the aspect of birth and blood. Grail is built around the concept of "pleasure" - although definitions of it may vary from one Grail Hour to another.

Sulochana Amavasya is the owner of the Ecdysis Club. She can be randomly met as a patron, by speaking about occult lore and impressing her with reason. 
Sulochana is extremely useful in that unlike other characters, you can talk to her about absolutely anything. This usually produces no effect, but since the timer of whatever you are speaking of is stopped and she has no coldown, this allows you to keep a limited duration card almost indefinitely (as long as you don't need to talk to someone else) by constantly talking to her about it.

"'My dear, I've been wanting to talk to you. Sometimes I fund scholars of the invisible arts. I'd like to offer you my support. A substantial contribution. And all you need to do, some day, is to introduce me to someone else who'll end matters properly'. She smiles, benignly."
Poppy's Request shows up with a 300s timer. When the timer is out, a Follower must be sacrificed. If one cannot be sacrificed, you are sacrificed instead and the game ends.

"Dr Ibn al-Adim, called the Aleppine, has an interest in overlooked history."
Dr. Ibn al-Adim is uncommon among the patrons in he doesn't have the Mortal aspect. This suggests that he may be immortal - possibly a member of the House of Lethe, which had an Aleppine branch, although his willingness to interact with the outside world would be strange if so. It has been speculated that he is Kamal al-Din ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad Ibn al-Adim, a 13th century biographer and historian from Aleppo.
Talking to Dr Ibn al-Adim gives a commission: Lantern, Secret Histories and Forge among them.

Studying with Dr Ibn al-Adim costs Sprintriae (Iron is sufficient), and yields Scholar: Aramaic.

"Count Gottlob Jannings represents a Continental confraternity of physicians and duellists. He has offered you a commission."
Count Jannings may be randomly met by talking about otherworldly knowledge. Talking to Count Jannings gives an Edge or Heart commission.
Studying with Count Jannings and any Spintria yields Scholar: Latin.
